messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 8
messages.msgSnippet: Done. :) Pam ... From: Mary Hickman  To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 8 Date: Fri, Dec 7,
messages.messageBody:
Done. :)

Pam

----------
From: "Mary Hickman" <mfhick@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 8
Date: Fri, Dec 7, 2001, 12:31 PM





Hello,

I'm Mary, mom to Ashley, Riley, and Tessa. 7, 5, 2. I would like to stay
here at the party. Could someone tell me how to put my mail on digest? I get
so much spam I prefer to read on digest. If someone can do it for me thank
you. If I need to do it, I work well with simple, clear instructions. I'm
living here in toddler zone and often have to put raging fires out moment by
moment. I long to think deeper with you all. I'm very quick with a wash
cloth when milk spills and very slow in techno world. My hubby, Tim is a
self taught techno genius. We love nature, gardening and reading. Talk to
you all soon.

Mary

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 8
messages.msgSnippet: I stumbled across a book called Herbal Rituals .  This book is written month by month.  The author
messages.messageBody:
<<a sense of connectedness with all beings and things>>

I stumbled across a book called "Herbal Rituals". This book is written
month by month. The author talks almost poetically about the rhythms of
nature, noticing them, very intimate moments in her life with nature and
sharing her love of the earth with children. She also mentions how several
religions interpret the changes of nature, from Paganism to Judaism. In
each month/chapter, she talks about a particular herb and gives recipes for
various herbal mixtures. I thought it was a wonderful book and gave me a
renewed way to look at our earth and how to share that with my kids. We
made several of the herbal mixtures and continue to use them.

Julie--who is so very glad to be here
